Sentencas: Among standard high-temperature cathode materials for solid oxide fuel cells, La0.8Sr0.2MnO3- (LSM) displays the least reactivity with the oxide-ion conductor La2Mo2O9 (LMO), yet a reaction is observed at high processing temperatures, identified by using XRD and focused ion beam secondary-ion mass spectrometry (FIB-SIMS) after annealing at 1050 and 1150 degrees C. Additionally, Sr and Mn solutions were deposited and annealed on LMO pellets, as well as a Mo solution on a LSM pellet.
Titulo: Cationic Intermixing and Reactivity at the La2Mo2O9/La0.8Sr0.2MnO3- Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolyte-Cathode Interface

Sentencas: From these studies several reaction products were identified by using XRD and located by using FIB-SIMS on the surface of pelletised samples.
Titulo: Cationic Intermixing and Reactivity at the La2Mo2O9/La0.8Sr0.2MnO3- Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolyte-Cathode Interface

Sentencas: We used depth profiling to show that the reactivity extended up to approximate to 10m from the surface region.
Titulo: Cationic Intermixing and Reactivity at the La2Mo2O9/La0.8Sr0.2MnO3- Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolyte-Cathode Interface

Sentencas: If Sr was present, a SrMoO4-type scheelite phase was always observed as a reaction product, and if Mn was present, LaMnO3+ single crystals were observed on the surface of the LMO pellets.
Titulo: Cationic Intermixing and Reactivity at the La2Mo2O9/La0.8Sr0.2MnO3- Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolyte-Cathode Interface

Sentencas: Additional phases such as La2MoO6 and La6MoO12 were also detected depending on the configuration and annealing temperature.
Titulo: Cationic Intermixing and Reactivity at the La2Mo2O9/La0.8Sr0.2MnO3- Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolyte-Cathode Interface

Sentencas: Reaction mechanisms and detailed reaction formulae are proposed to explain these observations.
Titulo: Cationic Intermixing and Reactivity at the La2Mo2O9/La0.8Sr0.2MnO3- Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolyte-Cathode Interface

Sentencas: The strongest driving force for cationic diffusion appears to originate from Mo6+ and Mn3+ cations, rather than from Sr2+.
Titulo: Cationic Intermixing and Reactivity at the La2Mo2O9/La0.8Sr0.2MnO3- Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolyte-Cathode Interface
